summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Interlochen Center for the Arts, demanding records of donations, tuition payments, and visits by Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The document includes a request for non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the ongoing criminal investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, requesting records related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Jeffrey Jocks
persons.role: Attorney for Interlochen Center for the Arts
persons.context: The subpoena is addressed to him as the attorney for Interlochen Center for the Arts, requesting production of records.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as an individual whose financial contributions and visits to Interlochen Center for the Arts are being investigated via the grand jury subpoena.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named alongside Jeffrey Epstein as an individual whose financial contributions and visits to Interlochen Center for the Arts are being investigated via the grand jury subpoena.

connections.description: Both are named together as subjects of the grand jury investigation regarding financial contributions and visits to Interlochen Center for the Arts.
Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is issuing a subpoena to investigate Epstein's financial activities and visits.
Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is issuing a subpoena to investigate Maxwell's financial activities and visits.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The subpoena commands Interlochen Center for the Arts to appear before the grand jury on this date to testify and produce records.

events.title: Subpoena Issuance
events.description: The grand jury subpoena was issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office, initiating a formal request for records related to Epstein and Maxwell.

locations: Interlochen Center for the Arts, 4000 Highway M-137, Interlochen, MI 49643
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office issued a grand jury subpoena to Interlochen Center for Arts seeking all records of donations, tuition payments, and visits by Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.
The subpoena specifically requests records from Interlochen Arts Camp and Interlochen Arts Academy, indicating the investigation is examining potential financial ties to educational institutions.
The government requested non-disclosure of the subpoena to preserve the confidentiality of the ongoing criminal investigation.
The subpoena cites 18 U.S.C. ยง 2423(a), which relates to transportation of minors for illegal sexual activity, suggesting the investigation's focus.
The document shows the investigation was active as of February 2020, after Epstein's death but before Maxwell's conviction.
